extension.name: VM2 Product Snapshot For Virtuemart
extension.author: Fiona Coulter
extension.description: Content plugin to embed Virtuemart 2 products into Joomla articles

field.name: showAddToCart
field.label: Show Add to Cart Button?
field.description: Defines whether the add to cart button is displayed or not.

field.name: showProductLink
field.label: Show Product Link?
field.description: Defines whether a link to the Virtuemart product page is displayed or not.

field.name: showPrice
field.label: Show Product Price?
field.description: Defines whether the product price is displayed or not.

field.name: showImage
field.label: Show Product Image?
field.description: Defines whether the product image is displayed or not.

field.name: showName
field.label: Show Product Name?
field.description: Defines whether the product name is displayed or not.

field.name: showCaption
field.label: Show Short Caption?
field.description: Show short caption taken from product short description

field.name: showSDescription
field.label: Show Short Description?
field.description: Defines whether the product short description displayed or not.

field.name: showDescription
field.label: Show Description?
field.description: Defines whether the product full description is displayed or not.

field.name: showStock
field.label: Show Items in Stock?
field.description: Defines whether the product stock levels are displayed.

field.name: showSKU
field.label: Show Product SKU?
field.description: Defines whether the product SKU is displayed.

field.name: addtocart
field.label: Button Text
field.description: text to display on add to cart button

field.name: linktext
field.label: Product Link Text
field.description: text to display on the link to Virtuemart product page.

field.name: captionLength
field.label: Caption Length
field.description: Number of characters to display from description.

field.name: loadStylesheet
field.label: Load Stylesheet
field.description: Should the plugin styleshheet be loaded. This is recommended, but if you wish to minimise the files that your page loads, you can set this to no and put the styling rules in your template css instead.
